description.message: Reload an unpacked extension with one click, a hotkey or automatically (extension for developers).

ports_help_text.message:
The "Advanced Extension Reloader Watch 1/2" sets up a server that listens on a specified port (default is 7220) and accepts connections from the "Advanced Extension Reloader".

The "Advanced Extension Reloader" connects to this server using the port specified here and listens for reload events. When a reload event is received, it automatically reloads the extension you're developing.

If you're developing multiple extensions, you should list the ports for all the servers you've created, separated by commas.

click_action_help_text_chrome.message:
An object that configures the behavior triggered when you click the Advanced Extension Reloader's icon or use the "Activate the extension" hotkey defined at chrome://extensions/shortcuts.

Accepted Properties:

hard: boolean
default: true
Determines whether to reload the entire extension (true) or just the current tab (false). If set to false, changes to the background script will not be applied. Even if set to true, changes to the manifest.json file will not be applied unless you use the listen() function from the "Advanced Extension Reloader Watch 2" supplementary npm package in your extension's background script. This option can be used in conjunction with all_tabs.

all_tabs: boolean
default: false
Specifies whether to reload all open tabs instead of just the current one.

ext_id: string
default: undefined
Defines the ID of the extension to reload. If left undefined, all extensions will be reloaded.

play_notifications: boolean
default: false
Indicates whether to play audio notifications for reload success.

after_reload_delay: number
default: 1000
Specifies the delay, in milliseconds, to wait after an extension is reloaded before reopening any closed tabs. If your extension experiences issues, such as errors or blank pages after a reload, you may want to increase this value.

Example:
{
    "all_tabs": false,
    "hard": true,
    "ext_id": "dphafhlelejgffkmbmnmomfehnekdnlj",
    "play_notifications": true
}

click_action_help_text_edge.message:
An object that configures the behavior triggered when you click the Advanced Extension Reloader's icon or use the "Activate the extension" hotkey defined at edge://extensions/shortcuts.

Accepted Properties:

hard: boolean
default: true
Determines whether to reload the entire extension (true) or just the current tab (false). If set to false, changes to the background script will not be applied. Even if set to true, changes to the manifest.json file will not be applied unless you use the listen() function from the "Advanced Extension Reloader Watch 2" supplementary npm package in your extension's background script. This option can be used in conjunction with all_tabs.

all_tabs: boolean
default: false
Specifies whether to reload all open tabs instead of just the current one.

ext_id: string
default: undefined
Defines the ID of the extension to reload. If left undefined, all extensions will be reloaded.

play_notifications: boolean
default: false
Indicates whether to play audio notifications for reload success.

after_reload_delay: number
default: 1000
Specifies the delay, in milliseconds, to wait after an extension is reloaded before reopening any closed tabs. If your extension experiences issues, such as errors or blank pages after a reload, you may want to increase this value.

context_menu_actions_help_text_chrome.message: An array of objects, each following the same schema as defined in "Extension icon click action", specifying additional reload actions to be included in the extension's icon context menu. Keep in mind that there may be only up to six actions in the extension's icon context menu. Additionally, you can trigger these reload actions by using the "Reload extension X" hotkeys defined at chrome://extensions/shortcuts, where X corresponds to the position of the action in the array + 1.

context_menu_actions_help_text_edge.message: An array of objects, each following the same schema as defined in "Extension icon click action", specifying additional reload actions to be included in the extension's icon context menu. Keep in mind that there may be only up to six actions in the extension's icon context menu. Additionally, you can trigger these reload actions by using the "Reload extension X" hotkeys defined at edge://extensions/shortcuts, where X corresponds to the position of the action in the array + 1.

invalid_ports_input_error_text.message: Invalid settings. Please separate each port with a comma. Invalid settings will not be saved.

invalid_reload_action_input_error_text.message: Invalid settings. Click the "?" button to view the list of allowed properties. Please ensure your JSON is valid. Invalid settings will not be saved.
